02306 
02307 /**
02308  * \ingroup  Mesh
02309  * \brief  Get information about edges and faces in a mesh.
02310  *
02311  * \description
02312  *
02313  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
02314  *
02315  * \modifications  
02316  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
02317  */
02318 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo(
02319   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
02320   int *numEdge,   /**< output - number of edges */
02321   int *numFace,   /**< output - number of faces */
02322   FC_ElementType *faceType    /**< output - face type (tri, quad or mixed) */
02323 ) {
02324   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02325   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02326   
02327   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02328   if (numEdge != NULL) 
02329     *numEdge = -1;
02330   if (numFace != NULL)
02331     *numFace = -1;
02332   if (faceType != NULL) 
02333     *faceType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN; 
02334   
02335   // check input
02336   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02337   if (meshSlot == NULL || (!numEdge && !numFace && !faceType) ) {
02338     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02339     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02340   }
02341   
02342   // log message
02343   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge and face info for mesh '%s'", 
02344                       meshSlot->header.name);
02345 
02346   // build edges & faces if necessary
02347   if (numEdge != NULL && meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
02348     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
02349     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02350       return rc;
02351   }
02352   if (numFace != NULL && meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
02353     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
02354     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02355       return rc;
02356   }
02357 
02358   // fill in requested values
02359   if (numEdge != NULL)
02360     *numEdge = meshSlot->numEdge;
02361   if (numFace != NULL)
02362     *numFace = meshSlot->numFace;
02363   if (faceType != NULL)
02364     *faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
02365   
02366   return FC_SUCCESS;
02367 }
02368 
02369 /**
02370  * \ingroup  Mesh
02371  * \brief  Get number of edges in a mesh.
02372  *
02373  * \description
02374  *
02375  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
02376  *
02377  * \modifications  
02378  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
02379  */
02380 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshNumEdge(
02381   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
02382   int *numEdge    /**< output - number of edges */
02383 ) {
02384   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02385   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02386   
02387   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02388   if (numEdge != NULL) 
02389     *numEdge = -1;
02390   
02391   // check input
02392   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02393   if (meshSlot == NULL || !numEdge) {
02394     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02395     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02396   }
02397   
02398   // log message
02399   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting num edge for mesh '%s'", 
02400                       meshSlot->header.name);
02401 
02402   // build edges & faces if necessary
02403   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
02404     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
02405     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02406       return rc;
02407   }
02408 
02409   // fill in requested values
02410   if (numEdge != NULL)
02411     *numEdge = meshSlot->numEdge;
02412   
02413   return FC_SUCCESS;
02414 }
02415 
02416 /**
02417  * \ingroup  Mesh
02418  * \brief  Get number of faces in a mesh.
02419  *
02420  * \description
02421  *
02422  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
02423  *
02424  * \modifications  
02425  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
02426  */
02427 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshNumFace(
02428   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
02429   int *numFace    /**< output - number of faces */
02430 ) {
02431   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02432   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02433   
02434   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02435   if (numFace != NULL)
02436     *numFace = -1;
02437   
02438   // check input
02439   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02440   if (meshSlot == NULL || !numFace) {
02441     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02442     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02443   }
02444   
02445   // log message
02446   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of faces for mesh '%s'", 
02447                       meshSlot->header.name);
02448 
02449   // build faces if necessary
02450   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
02451     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
02452     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02453       return rc;
02454   }
02455 
02456   // fill in requested values
02457   if (numFace != NULL)
02458     *numFace = meshSlot->numFace;
02459   
02460   return FC_SUCCESS;
02461 }
02462 
02463 /**
02464  * \ingroup  Mesh
02465  * \brief  Get element type of the face in the mesh.
02466  *
02467  * \description
02468  *
02469  *    If edges and faces do not yet exist, they are built.
02470  *    Pyramids and prisms may return the type FC_ET_MIXED.
02471  *
02472  * \modifications  
02473  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, created.
02474  */
02475 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceType(
02476   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh handle */
02477   FC_ElementType *faceType    /**< output - face type (tri, quad or mixed) */
02478 ) {
02479   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02480   
02481   // default values returned if anything goes wrong
02482   if (faceType != NULL) 
02483     *faceType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN; 
02484   
02485   // check input
02486   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02487   if (meshSlot == NULL || !faceType) {
02488     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02489     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02490   }
02491   
02492   // log message
02493   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge and face info for mesh '%s'", 
02494                       meshSlot->header.name);
02495 
02496   // fill in requested values
02497   if (faceType != NULL)
02498     *faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
02499   
02500   return FC_SUCCESS;
02501 }
02502 
02503 /**
02504  * \ingroup  Mesh
02505  * \brief  Returns number of a type of mesh entity.
02506  *
02507  * \description
02508  *
02509  *    If you ask for edges or faces and they don't exist yet, they will
02510  *    be built.
02511  *
02512  *    It is an error to ask for the association type FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET.
02513  *
02514  * \modifications  
02515  *    - 06/07/04 RM, Created.
02516  *    - 07/16/04 WSK, Changed name.
02517  */
02518 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshNumEntity(
02519   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
02520   FC_AssociationType assoc, /**< input - association type of entity */
02521   int *numEntity            /**< output - number of entities in the mesh */
02522 ) {
02523   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02524   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02525   // set up default return
02526   if (numEntity != NULL)
02527     *numEntity = -1;
02528     
02529   // check input
02530   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02531   if (meshSlot == NULL || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || 
02532       assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || numEntity == NULL) {
02533     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02534     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02535   }
02536 
02537   // log message
02538   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting number of entities of type %s for mesh '%s'", 
02539                       fc_getAssociationTypeText(assoc),
02540                       meshSlot->header.name);
02541 
02542   // get the number entities on the mesh for given assoc type
02543   // build edges & faces if necessary
02544   switch(assoc) {
02545   case FC_AT_VERTEX:   *numEntity = meshSlot->numVertex;   break;
02546   case FC_AT_EDGE:     
02547     if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
02548       rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
02549       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02550         return rc;
02551     }
02552     *numEntity = meshSlot->numEdge;     break;
02553   case FC_AT_FACE:     
02554     if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
02555       rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
02556       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02557         return rc;
02558     }
02559     *numEntity = meshSlot->numFace;     break; 
02560   case FC_AT_ELEMENT:  *numEntity = meshSlot->numElement;  break;
02561   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH:    *numEntity = 1;                     break;
02562   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:  // fall through to default
02563   default:
02564     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02565   }
02566   
02567   // should never reach here
02568   //fc_printfErrorMessage("Should never reach here");
02569   //return FC_ERROR;
02570   return FC_SUCCESS;
02571 }
02572 
02573 /**
02574  * \ingroup Mesh
02575  * \brief Get the element type of the mesh entity
02576  *
02577  * \description
02578  *
02579  *    This is really only interesting for faces and elements. The association
02580  *    type of "whole" returns the type of the elements of the mesh.
02581  *
02582  *    If you ask for edges or faces and they don't exist yet, they will
02583  *    be built.
02584  *
02585  *    It is an error to ask for the association type FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET.
02586  *
02587  * \modifications
02588  *    - 07/16/04 WSK Created.
02589  */
02590 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEntityElementType(
02591   FC_Mesh mesh,              /**< input - mesh */
02592   FC_AssociationType assoc,  /**< input - the entity's type */
02593   int ID,                    /**< input - the ID of the mesh entity */
02594   FC_ElementType* elemType   /**< output - the element type of the entity */
02595 ) {
02596   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02597   int num;
02598   FC_ElementType* faceTypes;
02599 
02600   // default return
02601   if (elemType)
02602     *elemType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
02603 
02604   // check input
02605   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || 
02606       assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || ID < 0 || !elemType)
02607     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02608   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, assoc, &num);
02609   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02610     return rc;
02611   if (ID >= num)
02612     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02613 
02614   switch (assoc) {
02615   case FC_AT_VERTEX: *elemType = FC_ET_POINT; break;
02616   case FC_AT_EDGE:   *elemType = FC_ET_LINE;  break;
02617   case FC_AT_FACE:
02618     fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(mesh, &faceTypes);
02619     *elemType = faceTypes[ID];
02620     break;
02621   case FC_AT_ELEMENT: // fall through to FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH
02622   case FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH: fc_getMeshElementType(mesh, elemType); break;
02623   case FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET: // fall through to FC_AT_UNKNOWN
02624   case FC_AT_UNKNOWN:
02625     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02626   }
02627   
02628   return FC_SUCCESS;
02629 }
02630     
02631 //@}
02632 
02633 /** \name Get mesh big data. */
02634 //-------------------------------
02635 //@{
02636 
02637 /**
02638  * \ingroup  Mesh
02639  * \brief  Return the vertex coordinates of the mesh.
02640  *
02641  * \description
02642  *
02643  *    Return an array containing the values of each vertex location.  If the
02644  *    vertices are 2D, the array has X0, Y0, X1, Y1, etc - interleaved.  If the
02645  *    vertices are 3D, the array has X0, Y0, Z0, X1, Y1, Z1, ...  The user gets
02646  *    a pointer back to a shared array and should treat it as read only.  To
02647  *    modify any of the values the user must first make a copy.
02648  *
02649  *    Note, you can index to coordinate j of the ith vertex directly as
02650  *    coords[i*numDim + j];
02651  *
02652  * \modifications  
02653  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
02654  */
02655 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(
02656   FC_Mesh mesh,      /**< input - mesh */
02657   double **coords_p  /**< output - vertices. user should treat as read only */
02658 ) {
02659   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02660   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02661 
02662   // default return
02663   if (coords_p)
02664     *coords_p = NULL;
02665 
02666   // check input
02667   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02668   if (meshSlot == NULL || coords_p == NULL) {
02669     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02670     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02671   }
02672   
02673   // log message
02674   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting coordinates for mesh '%s'", 
02675                       meshSlot->header.name);
02676 
02677 
02678   // lazy fetching of coords
02679   if (meshSlot->coords == NULL && meshSlot->header.committed == 1) {
02680     rc = _fc_readMeshCoords(mesh);
02681     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
02682       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of coords for mesh '%s' failed",
02683                             meshSlot->header.name);
02684       return rc;
02685     }
02686   }
02687 
02688   // fill in requested value
02689   *coords_p = meshSlot->coords;
02690   
02691   return FC_SUCCESS;
02692 }
02693 
02694 /**
02695  * \ingroup  Mesh
02696  * \brief  Return the vertex coordinates of the mesh as a variable.
02697  *
02698  * \description
02699  * 
02700  *    Returns the variable which is the coords of the mesh, creating it on 
02701  *    the first call to this function (and returning the same handle on
02702  *    successive calls). The name of the variable will be 'coordinates'.
02703  *
02704  *    The official coords variable is treated a little differently from regular
02705  *    variables.  Calling this routine always provides a handle to the same
02706  *    variable.  However, making a copy gives back a normal variable with the
02707  *    same data (it's not an official coords variable).
02708  *
02709  *    This variable will not be written to disk when the dataset containing
02710  *    it is written to disk. If a copy of a mesh with a coords variable 
02711  *    is made, the copied mesh will have an existing coords variable.
02712  *
02713  * \modifications  
02714  *    - 09/15/04 WSK, Created.
02715  */
02716 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshCoordsAsVariable(
02717   FC_Mesh mesh,      /**< input - mesh */
02718   FC_Variable *coords_var /**< output - variable containing coords */
02719 ) {
02720   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02721   FC_MathType mathType;
02722   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02723   double* coords_p;
02724 
02725   // default return
02726   if (coords_var)
02727     *coords_var = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
02728 
02729   // check input
02730   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02731   if (meshSlot == NULL || coords_var == NULL) {
02732     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02733     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02734   }
02735   
02736   // log message
02737   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating coordinates variable for mesh '%s'", 
02738                       meshSlot->header.name);
02739 
02740   // If the coords variable already exists, return it
02741   if (meshSlot->coordVarID > -1) {
02742     _FC_GET_HANDLE(*coords_var, _fc_getVarSlotFromID(meshSlot->coordVarID));
02743     return FC_SUCCESS;
02744   }
02745 
02746   // create the variable
02747   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
02748   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02749     return rc;
02750   if (meshSlot->dim == 1)
02751     mathType = FC_MT_SCALAR;
02752   else
02753     mathType = FC_MT_VECTOR;
02754   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "coords", coords_var);
02755   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02756     return rc;
02757   rc = fc_setVariableData(*coords_var, meshSlot->numVertex, meshSlot->dim,
02758                           FC_AT_VERTEX, mathType, FC_DT_DOUBLE,
02759                           (void*)coords_p);
02760   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02761     return FC_ERROR;
02762 
02763   // set the coord var
02764   meshSlot->coordVarID = coords_var->slotID;
02765   
02766   return FC_SUCCESS;
02767 }
02768 
02769 /**
02770  * \ingroup  Mesh
02771  * \brief  Return edge connectivities
02772  *
02773  * \description
02774  *  
02775  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that
02776  *    has the IDs of the vertices that make up the edges. The array
02777  *    is { Edge0Vert0 Edge0Vert1 Edge1Vert0 Edge1Vert1 ... EdgeNVert0 EdgeNVert1 }.
02778  *    This is a big data array and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
02779  *
02780  *    You can index to the jth vertex of the ith edge directly as conns[i*2 + j];
02781  *
02782  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
02783  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
02784  *
02785  * \modifications
02786  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, created.
02787  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, removed args for non-big data values which can
02788  *      now be gotten with fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo().
02789  */
02790 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(
02791   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
02792   int **conns_p    /**< output - edge to vertex connections, treat read only */
02793 ) {
02794   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02795   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02796   
02797   // default return
02798   if (conns_p)
02799     *conns_p = NULL;
02800 
02801   // check input
02802   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02803   if (meshSlot == NULL || conns_p == NULL) {
02804     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02805     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02806   }
02807   
02808   // log message
02809   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
02810                       meshSlot->header.name);
02811 
02812   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
02813   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
02814     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
02815     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02816       return rc;
02817   }
02818 
02819   // return pointer
02820   *conns_p = meshSlot->edgeToVertConns;
02821   
02822   return FC_SUCCESS;
02823 }
02824 
02825 /**
02826  * \ingroup  Mesh
02827  * \brief  Return face types
02828  *
02829  * \description
02830  *
02831  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that
02832  *    has the element type of each face.
02833  *    This is a big data array and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
02834  *
02835  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
02836  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
02837  *
02838  * \modifications
02839  *    - 10/25/05 WSD, created.
02840  */
02841 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(
02842   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
02843   FC_ElementType **faceTypes_p    /**< output - face types, treat read only */
02844 ) {
02845   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02846   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02847   
02848   // default return
02849   if (faceTypes_p)
02850     *faceTypes_p = NULL;
02851 
02852   // check input
02853   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02854   if (meshSlot == NULL || faceTypes_p == NULL) {
02855     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02856     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02857   }
02858   
02859   // log message
02860   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
02861                       meshSlot->header.name);
02862 
02863   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
02864   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
02865     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
02866     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02867       return rc;
02868   }
02869 
02870   // return pointer
02871   *faceTypes_p = meshSlot->faceTypes;
02872   
02873   return FC_SUCCESS;
02874 }
02875 
02876 /**
02877  * \ingroup  Mesh
02878  * \brief  Return face connectivities
02879  *
02880  * \description  
02881  *
02882  *    This routine returns an array that has the IDs of the vertices that make
02883  *    up the faces. In addition there is an array with the number of vertices
02884  *    per face because some element types have multiple types of faces
02885  *    (i.e. pyramids and prisms).  For example, if the faces are triangles,
02886  *    every entry of the numVertPerFace array will be '3' and the connectivity
02887  *    array will look like { Face0Vert0 Face0Vert1 Face0Vert2 Face1Vert0
02888  *    ... FaceNVert0 FaceNVert1 FaceNVert2 }. 
02889  *
02890  *    If the face type is mixed, the connectivity array will be
02891  *    maxNumVertPerFace * numFace long and the unused entries (for when
02892  *    numVertPerFace < maxNumVertPerFace) will be equal to -1.  For example, a
02893  *    prism mesh's face connectivity might have numVertPerFace = { 3 4 3 ... }
02894  *    and conns = { Face0Vert0 Face0Vert1 Face0Vert2 -1 Face1Vert0 Face1Vert1
02895  *    Face1Vert2 Face1Vert3 Face2Vert0 Face2Vert1 Face2Vert2 -1 ... }.
02896  *    Note you can index directly to face n by conns[n*maxNumVertPerFace].
02897  *
02898  *    The number of vertices per face and the connectivity arrays are both
02899  *    considered to big data arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling
02900  *    program. Fetching the numVertPerFaceArray is optional.
02901  * 
02902  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
02903  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
02904  *
02905  * \modifications
02906  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, created.
02907  *    - 09/21/04 WSK, removed args for non-big data values which can
02908  *      now be gotten with fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo().
02909  */
02910 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(
02911   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh */
02912   int** numVertPerFace_p,  /**< output -  (optional) num vert per face, 
02913                               treat read only */
02914   int* maxNumVertPerFace_p,  /**< output - (optional) stride length of the
02915                               conns array */ 
02916   int **conns_p   /**< output - face to vertex connections, treat read only */
02917 ) {
02918   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02919   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02920   
02921   // default return
02922   if (numVertPerFace_p)
02923     *numVertPerFace_p = NULL;
02924   if (maxNumVertPerFace_p)
02925     *maxNumVertPerFace_p = -1;
02926   if (conns_p)
02927     *conns_p = NULL;
02928 
02929   // check input
02930   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02931   if (meshSlot == NULL || !conns_p) {
02932     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02933     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02934   }
02935   
02936   // log message
02937   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting face connectivities for mesh '%s'", 
02938                       meshSlot->header.name);
02939 
02940   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
02941   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
02942     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
02943     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02944       return rc;
02945   }
02946 
02947   // return values
02948   if (numVertPerFace_p)
02949     *numVertPerFace_p = meshSlot->numVertPerFace;
02950   if (maxNumVertPerFace_p) {
02951     FC_ElementType faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType);
02952     if (faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
02953       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = 4; // assume will be mix of tris and quads
02954     else if (faceType == FC_ET_UNKNOWN)
02955       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = 0;
02956     else
02957       *maxNumVertPerFace_p = meshSlot->numVertPerFace[0];
02958   } 
02959   *conns_p = meshSlot->faceToVertConns;
02960   
02961   return FC_SUCCESS;
02962 }
02963 
02964 /**
02965  * \ingroup  Mesh
02966  * \brief  Return element to vertex connectivities for the mesh
02967  *
02968  * \description
02969  *
02970  *    Return actual element indices.  The return value is a pointer to an array
02971  *    of integers.  The user must treat this array as read only.  To modify any
02972  *    values, the user must make a copy first.  If each element contains N
02973  *    vertices, the first N integers are for element 0, the next N integers are
02974  *    element 1, etc. To get the jth vertex ID of the ith element index
02975  *    as conns[i*numVertPrElem + j]. numVertPerElem can be find by calling
02976  *    fc_getElementTypeNumVertex() or fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
02977  *
02978  * \modifications  
02979  *    - Nancy Collins, Created.
02980  */
02981 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(
02982   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< input - mesh */
02983   int **conns_p   /**< output - element index buffer, treat read only */
02984 ) {
02985   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02986   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
02987   
02988   // default return
02989   if (conns_p)
02990     *conns_p = NULL;
02991 
02992   // check input
02993   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
02994   if (meshSlot == NULL || conns_p == NULL) {
02995     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02996     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02997   }
02998   
02999   // log message
03000   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element connectivities for mesh '%s'", 
03001                       meshSlot->header.name);
03002 
03003   // lazy fetching of conns
03004   if (meshSlot->elemToVertConns == NULL && meshSlot->header.committed == 1) {
03005     rc = _fc_readMeshElemConns(mesh);
03006     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03007       fc_printfErrorMessage("Lazy loading of conns for mesh '%s' failed",
03008                             meshSlot->header.name);
03009       return rc;
03010     }
03011   }
03012 
03013   // fill in requested value
03014   *conns_p = meshSlot->elemToVertConns;
03015   
03016   return FC_SUCCESS;
03017 }
03018 
03019 /**
03020  * \ingroup  Mesh
03021  * \brief  Return element to edge connectivities.
03022  *
03023  * \description
03024  *
03025  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has the IDs of the edges
03026  *    that make up the elements. The array is { Elem0Edge0 Elem0Edge1
03027  *    ... Elem0EdgeN Elem1Edge0 Elem1Edge1 ... Elem1EdgeN ...... ElemMEdge0
03028  *    ElemMEdge1 ... ElemMEdgeN }.  This is a big data array and should NOT be
03029  *    freed by the calling program. To get the id of the jth edge in the ith
03030  *    element, index by conns[i*numEdgePerElem+j]. numEdgePerElem can be
03031  *    found by a call to fc_getElementTypeNumEdge() or
03032  *    fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
03033  *
03034  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03035  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03036  *
03037  * \modifications
03038  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03039  */
03040 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(
03041   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03042   int **elemToEdgeConns_p   /**< output - element to edge connections, 
03043                                treat read only */
03044 ) {
03045   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03046   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03047   
03048   // default return
03049   if (elemToEdgeConns_p)
03050     *elemToEdgeConns_p = NULL;
03051 
03052   // check input
03053   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03054   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemToEdgeConns_p == NULL) {
03055     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03056     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03057   }
03058   
03059   // log message
03060   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to edge connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03061                       meshSlot->header.name);
03062 
03063   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03064   if (meshSlot->numEdge == -1) {
03065     rc = _fc_buildEdgeConns(mesh);
03066     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03067       return rc;
03068   }
03069 
03070   // return pointer
03071   *elemToEdgeConns_p = meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns;
03072   
03073   return FC_SUCCESS;
03074 }
03075 
03076 /**
03077  * \ingroup  Mesh
03078  * \brief  Return element to face connectivities.
03079  *
03080  * \description
03081  *
03082  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has the IDs of the faces
03083  *    that make up the elements. The array is { Elem0Face0 Elem0Face1
03084  *    ... Elem0FaceN Elem1Face0 Elem1Face1 ... Elem1FaceN ...... ElemMFace0
03085  *    ElemMFace1 ... ElemMFaceN }.  This is a big data array and should NOT be
03086  *    freed by the calling program. To get the id of the jth face in the ith
03087  *    element, index by conns[i*numFacePerElem+j]. numFacePerElem can be
03088  *    found by a call to fc_getElementTypeNumFace() or
03089  *    fc_getElementTypeNumEntity().
03090  *
03091  *    See also fc_getMeshElementFaceOrientsPtr().
03092  *
03093  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03094  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03095  *
03096  * \modifications
03097  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03098  */
03099 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(
03100   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03101   int **elemToFaceConns_p   /**< output - element to face connections, 
03102                                treat read only */
03103 ) {
03104   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03105   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03106   
03107   // default return
03108   if (elemToFaceConns_p)
03109     *elemToFaceConns_p = NULL;
03110 
03111   // check input
03112   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03113   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemToFaceConns_p == NULL) {
03114     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03115     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03116   }
03117   
03118   // log message
03119   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to face connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03120                       meshSlot->header.name);
03121 
03122   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03123   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03124     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03125     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03126       return rc;
03127   }
03128 
03129   // return pointer
03130   *elemToFaceConns_p = meshSlot->elemToFaceConns;
03131   
03132   return FC_SUCCESS;
03133 }
03134 
03135 /**
03136  * \ingroup  Mesh
03137  * \brief  Return element's face's orientations relative to global faces.
03138  *
03139  * \description
03140  *
03141  *    By definition, the vertices of the faces of an element are ordered
03142  *    (counter clockwise) so that the face's normal points out of the element.
03143  *    In the gobal face array for a mesh, however, the vertices are (somewhat)
03144  *    arbitrarily ordered and you cannot know for sure the direction of
03145  *    a face without reference to an element. For example, a face shared by
03146  *    two elements has a different orientation depending on which element
03147  *    you are talking about. Let's say that the face was defined so that
03148  *    it points out of the first element. Then the entry of the faceOrients
03149  *    array for that face of the first element is 1. The faceOrients value
03150  *    for that face in the second element is -1. The -1 tells you that you
03151  *    need to reverse the order of the vertices of that face in order to
03152  *    treat it as if it had come from the second element. 
03153  *
03154  *    This routine returns a pointer to the array that has orientation flags
03155  *    for the faces that make up the elements. The array is ordered {
03156  *    Elem0Face0 Elem0Face1 ... Elem0FaceN Elem1Face0 Elem1Face1 ... Elem1FaceN
03157  *    ...... ElemMFace0 ElemMFace1 ... ElemMFaceN }.  This is a big data array
03158  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program. Possible values are 1:
03159  *    vertices of the face are in order expected for the element; or -1:
03160  *    vertices of the face are in the reverse order of that expected for the
03161  *    element. 
03162  *
03163  *    (I'm pretty sure that all unique faces will have orient = 1.)
03164  *
03165  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03166  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03167  *
03168  * \modifications
03169  *    - 10/26/05 WSD, created.
03170  */
03171 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshElementFaceOrientsPtr(
03172   FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - mesh */
03173   int **elemFaceOrients_p   /**< output - element's face's orientations, 
03174                                treat read only */
03175 ) {
03176   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03177   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03178   
03179   // default return
03180   if (elemFaceOrients_p)
03181     *elemFaceOrients_p = NULL;
03182 
03183   // check input
03184   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03185   if (meshSlot == NULL || elemFaceOrients_p == NULL) {
03186     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03187     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03188   }
03189   
03190   // log message
03191   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting element to face connectivities on mesh '%s'", 
03192                       meshSlot->header.name);
03193 
03194   // if it doesn't exist, build vertex, element & neighbor stuff
03195   if (meshSlot->numFace == -1) {
03196     rc = _fc_buildFaceConns(mesh);
03197     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03198       return rc;
03199   }
03200 
03201   // return pointer
03202   *elemFaceOrients_p = meshSlot->elemFaceOrients;
03203   
03204   return FC_SUCCESS;
03205 }
03206 
03207 //@}
03208 
03209 /** \name Print mesh. */
03210 //-------------------------------
03211 //@{
03212 
03213 /**
03214  * \ingroup  Mesh
03215  * \brief Print mesh meta data to stdout, and optionally the connections
03216  *        and/or coordinates.
03217  *
03218  * \modifications 
03219  *    - 11/20/03 WSK Created.
03220  *    - 10/31/07 ACG optional precision
03221  */
03222 FC_ReturnCode fc_printMesh(
03223   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh */
03224   char* label,          /**< input - label to prepend variable name with, 
03225                                      can be NULL */
03226   int print_edgeConns,  /**< input > 0  = print the edge connectivities. */
03227   int print_faceConns,  /**< input > 0 = print the face connectivities. */
03228   int print_elemConns,  /**< input > 0 = print the element connectivities. */
03229   int print_coords      /**< input - 1 = print the coordinates too
03230                   2 = print the coordinates in exponential notation w 5 digits precision */
03231 
03232 ) {
03233   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03234   int i, j;
03235   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03236   int topodim, dim, numVertex, numElement, numSubset, numVar, numSeqVar;
03237   int numEdge, numFace;
03238   FC_ElementType elemType, faceType;
03239   int* ebuf, *numVertPerFace, maxNum;
03240   double* vbuf;
03241 
03242   // special case: printing a null handle is not an error
03243   if (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, FC_NULL_MESH)) {
03244     printf("Mesh: FC_NULL_MESH\n");
03245     fflush(NULL);
03246     return FC_SUCCESS;
03247   }
03248 
03249   // check input
03250   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03251   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
03252     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03253     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03254   }
03255 
03256   // log message
03257   fc_printfLogMessage("Printing mesh '%s'", meshSlot->header.name);
03258 
03259   // print label & var name
03260   if (label)
03261     printf("%s: ", label);
03262   else
03263     printf("Mesh: ");
03264   printf("'%s'\n", meshSlot->header.name);
03265   fflush(NULL);
03266 
03267   // print meta data
03268   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh,  &topodim, &dim, &numVertex, &numElement,
03269                       &elemType);
03270   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03271     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get info for mesh '%s'",
03272                           meshSlot->header.name);
03273     return rc;
03274   }
03275   rc = fc_getNumSubset(mesh, &numSubset);
03276   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03277     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get subsets for mesh '%s'",
03278                           meshSlot->header.name);
03279     return rc;
03280   }
03281   rc = fc_getNumVariable(mesh, &numVar);
03282   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03283     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get variables for mesh '%s'",
03284                           meshSlot->header.name);
03285     return rc;
03286   }
03287   rc = fc_getNumSeqVariable(mesh, &numSeqVar);
03288   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03289     fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get seq variables for mesh '%s'",
03290                           meshSlot->header.name);
03291     return rc;
03292   }
03293   printf("%snumVertex = %d, dim = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numVertex, dim);
03294   printf("%snumElement = %d, topodim = %d, elemType = %s\n", INDENT_STR,
03295          numElement, topodim, fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
03296   printf("%snumSubset = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numSubset);
03297   printf("%snumVar = %d, numSeqVar = %d\n", INDENT_STR, numVar, numSeqVar);
03298   fflush(NULL);
03299   
03300   // print edge connectivities
03301   if (print_edgeConns > 0) {
03302     if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0) {
03303       printf("%sEdges have not been built for this mesh\n", INDENT_STR);
03304       fflush(NULL);
03305     }
03306     else {
03307       rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
03308       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03309         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get numEdge for mesh '%s'",
03310                                meshSlot->header.name);
03311         return rc;
03312       }
03313       rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &ebuf);
03314       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03315         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge conns for mesh '%s'",
03316                               meshSlot->header.name);
03317         return rc;
03318       }
03319       
03320       // print the conns
03321       printf("%sEdge connectivities (2 vertices per edge):\n", INDENT_STR);
03322       for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) {
03323         printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
03324         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
03325           printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*2 + j]);
03326           fflush(NULL);
03327         }
03328         printf("\n");
03329         fflush(NULL);
03330       }
03331     }
03332   }
03333   
03334   // print face connectivities
03335   if (print_faceConns > 0) {
03336     if (meshSlot->numFace < 0) {
03337       printf("%sFaces have not been built for this mesh\n", INDENT_STR);
03338       fflush(NULL);
03339     }
03340     else {
03341       rc = fc_getMeshEdgeFaceInfo(mesh, NULL, &numFace, &faceType);
03342       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03343         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge/face info for mesh '%s'",
03344                               meshSlot->header.name);
03345         return rc;
03346       }
03347       rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFace, &maxNum, &ebuf);
03348       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03349         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get edge conns for mesh '%s'",
03350                               meshSlot->header.name);
03351         return rc;
03352       }
03353       
03354       // print the conns
03355       if (faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
03356         printf("%sFace connectivities (faceType = %s, 3 or 4 vertices per "
03357                "element):\n", INDENT_STR, fc_getElementTypeText(faceType));
03358       else
03359         printf("%sFace connectivities (faceType = %s, %d vertices per "
03360                "element):\n", INDENT_STR, fc_getElementTypeText(faceType), 
03361                fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceType));
03362       fflush(NULL);
03363       for (i = 0; i < numFace; i++) {
03364         printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
03365         for (j = 0; j < numVertPerFace[i]; j++) { 
03366           printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*maxNum+j]);
03367           fflush(NULL);
03368         }
03369         printf("\n");
03370         fflush(NULL);
03371       }
03372     }
03373   }
03374   
03375   // print element connectivities
03376   if (print_elemConns > 0) {
03377     int numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
03378     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &ebuf);
03379     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03380       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get element conns for mesh '%s'",
03381                             meshSlot->header.name);
03382       return FC_ERROR;
03383     }
03384     
03385     // print the conns
03386     printf("%sElement connectivities (%d vertices per element):\n", 
03387            INDENT_STR, numVertPerElem);
03388     fflush(NULL);
03389     for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
03390       printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
03391       for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++) {
03392         printf("%6d ", ebuf[i*numVertPerElem + j]);
03393         fflush(NULL);
03394       }
03395       printf("\n");
03396       fflush(NULL);
03397     }
03398   }
03399   
03400   // print coords
03401   if (print_coords > 0) {
03402     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &vbuf);
03403     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03404       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to get coords for mesh '%s'",
03405                             meshSlot->header.name);
03406       return FC_ERROR;
03407     }
03408     
03409     // print the coordinates per vertex
03410     printf("%sVertex Coordinates:\n", INDENT_STR);
03411     fflush(NULL);
03412     for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
03413       printf("%s%s%d:  ", INDENT_STR, INDENT_STR, i);
03414       for (j = 0; j < dim; j++) {
03415         // see comment on precision in for DOUBLE case in fc_printVariable()
03416         //printf("%20.15g ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
03417      switch (print_coords){
03418      case 2:
03419        printf("%5le ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
03420        break;
03421      default:
03422        printf("%16.11g ", vbuf[i*dim + j]);
03423        break;
03424      }
03425         fflush(NULL);
03426       }
03427       printf("\n");
03428       fflush(NULL);
03429     }
03430   }
03431   
03432   return FC_SUCCESS;
03433 }
03434 
03435 //@}
03436 
03437 /**
03438  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03439  * \brief  Return parent edges of the vertices.
03440  *
03441  * \description
03442  *
03443  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03444  *    parent edges for each vertex and the IDs of the parent edges for
03445  *    each vertex. The array with the edge IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
03446  *    edge parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an edge parent ID by
03447  *
03448  *    edgeParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
03449  *
03450  *    where i is 0 ... numEdgePerVert[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays
03451  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03452  *
03453  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03454  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03455  *   
03456  *    Also note that if there cannot be any edges on the mesh (only happens
03457  *    for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
03458  *
03459  * \modifications
03460  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
03461  */
03462 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshEdgeParentsOfVerticesPtr(
03463   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03464   int** numEdgePerVert,     /**< output - array of number of edge parents per
03465                                vertex */
03466   int*** edgeParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of edge parent IDs, 
03467                                treat read only */
03468 ) {
03469   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03470   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03471   
03472   // default return
03473   if (numEdgePerVert)
03474     *numEdgePerVert = NULL;
03475   if (edgeParentsPerVert)
03476     *edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
03477 
03478   // check input
03479   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03480   if (meshSlot == NULL || numEdgePerVert == NULL ||
03481       edgeParentsPerVert == NULL) {
03482     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03483     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03484   }
03485   
03486   // log message
03487   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent edges of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
03488                       meshSlot->header.name);
03489 
03490   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03491   if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0 || 
03492       (meshSlot->numEdge > 0 && meshSlot->numEdgePerVert == NULL)) {
03493     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_EDGE);
03494     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03495       return rc;
03496   }
03497 
03498   // return pointers
03499   *numEdgePerVert = meshSlot->numEdgePerVert;
03500   *edgeParentsPerVert = meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert;
03501   
03502   return FC_SUCCESS;
03503 }
03504 
03505 /**
03506  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03507  * \brief  Return parent faces of the vertices.
03508  *
03509  * \description
03510  *
03511  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03512  *    parent faces for each vertex and the IDs of the parent faces for
03513  *    each vertex. The array with the face IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
03514  *    face parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an face parent ID by
03515  *
03516  *    faceParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
03517  *
03518  *    where i is 0 ... numFacePerVert[vertID] - 1. These are big data arrays
03519  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03520  *
03521  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03522  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03523  *
03524  *    Also note that if there cannot be any faces on the mesh (only happens
03525  *    for point and line meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
03526  *
03527  * \modifications
03528  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
03529  */
03530 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshFaceParentsOfVerticesPtr(
03531   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03532   int** numFacePerVert,     /**< output - array of number of face parents per
03533                                vertex */
03534   int*** faceParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of face parent IDs, 
03535                                treat read only */
03536 ) {
03537   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03538   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03539   
03540   // default return
03541   if (numFacePerVert)
03542     *numFacePerVert = NULL;
03543   if (faceParentsPerVert)
03544     *faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
03545 
03546   // check input
03547   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03548   if (meshSlot == NULL || numFacePerVert == NULL ||
03549       faceParentsPerVert == NULL) {
03550     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03551     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03552   }
03553   
03554   // log message
03555   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent faces of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
03556                       meshSlot->header.name);
03557 
03558   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03559   if (meshSlot->numFace < 0 || 
03560       (meshSlot->numFace > 0 && meshSlot->numFacePerVert == NULL)) {
03561     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_FACE);
03562     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03563       return rc;
03564   }
03565 
03566   // return pointers
03567   *numFacePerVert = meshSlot->numFacePerVert;
03568   *faceParentsPerVert = meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert;
03569   
03570   return FC_SUCCESS;
03571 }
03572 
03573 /**
03574  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03575  * \brief  Return parent elements of the vertices.
03576  *
03577  * \description
03578  *
03579  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03580  *    parent elements for each vertex and the IDs of the parent elements for
03581  *    each vertex. The array with the element IDs is a 2D array. Each vertex's
03582  *    element parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an element parent ID by
03583  *
03584  *    elemParentsPerVert[VertID][i];
03585  *
03586  *    where i is 0 ... numElemPerVert[vertID] - 1. These are a big data arrays and
03587  *    should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03588  *
03589  * \modifications
03590  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
03591  */
03592 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfVerticesPtr(
03593   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03594   int** numElemPerVert,     /**< output - array of number of elem parents per
03595                                vertex */
03596   int*** elemParentsPerVert /**< output - array of arrays of elem parent IDs, 
03597                                treat read only */
03598 ) {
03599   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03600   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03601   
03602   // default return
03603   if (numElemPerVert)
03604     *numElemPerVert = NULL;
03605   if (elemParentsPerVert)
03606     *elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
03607 
03608   // check input
03609   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03610   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemPerVert == NULL ||
03611       elemParentsPerVert == NULL) {
03612     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03613     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03614   }
03615   
03616   // log message
03617   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the vertices on mesh '%s'", 
03618                       meshSlot->header.name);
03619 
03620   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03621   if (!meshSlot->numElemPerVert) {
03622     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, FC_AT_ELEMENT);
03623     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03624       return rc;
03625   }
03626 
03627   // return pointers
03628   *numElemPerVert = meshSlot->numElemPerVert;
03629   *elemParentsPerVert = meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert;
03630   
03631   return FC_SUCCESS;
03632 }
03633 
03634 /**
03635  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03636  * \brief  Return parent elements of the edges.
03637  *
03638  * \description
03639  *
03640  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03641  *    parent elements for each edge and the IDs of the parent elements for
03642  *    each edge. The array with the element IDs is a 2D array. Each edge's
03643  *    element parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an element parent ID by
03644  *
03645  *    elemParentsPerEdge[EdgeID][i];
03646  *
03647  *    where i is 0 ... numElemPerEdge[edgeID] - 1. These are big data arrays
03648  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03649  *
03650  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03651  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03652  *
03653  * \modifications
03654  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
03655  */
03656 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfEdgesPtr(
03657   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03658   int** numElemPerEdge,     /**< output - array of number of elem parents per
03659                                edge */
03660   int*** elemParentsPerEdge /**< output - array of arrays of elem parent IDs, 
03661                                treat read only */
03662 ) {
03663   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03664   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03665   
03666   // default return
03667   if (numElemPerEdge)
03668     *numElemPerEdge = NULL;
03669   if (elemParentsPerEdge)
03670     *elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
03671 
03672   // check input
03673   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03674   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemPerEdge == NULL ||
03675       elemParentsPerEdge == NULL) {
03676     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03677     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03678   }
03679   
03680   // log message
03681   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the edges on mesh '%s'", 
03682                       meshSlot->header.name);
03683 
03684   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03685   if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0 || 
03686       (meshSlot->numEdge > 0 && meshSlot->numElemPerEdge == NULL)) {
03687     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_EDGE, FC_AT_ELEMENT);
03688     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03689       return rc;
03690   }
03691 
03692   // return pointers
03693   *numElemPerEdge = meshSlot->numElemPerEdge;
03694   *elemParentsPerEdge = meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge;
03695   
03696   return FC_SUCCESS;
03697 }
03698 
03699 /**
03700  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03701  * \brief  Return parent elements of the faces.
03702  *
03703  * \description
03704  *
03705  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03706  *    parent elements for each face and the IDs of the parent elements for
03707  *    each face. The array with the element IDs is a 2D array. Each face's
03708  *    element parent IDs are in sorted order. Get an element parent ID by
03709  *
03710  *    elemParentsPerFace[FaceID][i];
03711  *
03712  *    where i is 0 ... numElemPerFace[faceID] - 1. These are big data arrays
03713  *    and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03714  *
03715  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03716  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03717  *
03718  * \modifications
03719  *    - 10/27/05 WSD, created.
03720  */
03721 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfFacesPtr(
03722   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03723   int** numElemPerFace,     /**< output - array of number of elem parents per
03724                                face */
03725   int*** elemParentsPerFace /**< output - array of arrays of elem parent IDs, 
03726                                treat read only */
03727 ) {
03728   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03729   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03730   
03731   // default return
03732   if (numElemPerFace)
03733     *numElemPerFace = NULL;
03734   if (elemParentsPerFace)
03735     *elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
03736 
03737   // check input
03738   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03739   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemPerFace == NULL ||
03740       elemParentsPerFace == NULL) {
03741     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03742     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03743   }
03744   
03745   // log message
03746   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the faces on mesh '%s'", 
03747                       meshSlot->header.name);
03748 
03749   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03750   if (meshSlot->numFace < 0 || 
03751       (meshSlot->numFace > 0 && meshSlot->numElemPerFace == NULL)) {
03752     rc = _fc_buildParents(mesh, FC_AT_FACE, FC_AT_ELEMENT);
03753     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03754       return rc;
03755   }
03756 
03757   // return pointers
03758   *numElemPerFace = meshSlot->numElemPerFace;
03759   *elemParentsPerFace = meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace;
03760   
03761   return FC_SUCCESS;
03762 }
03763 
03764 /**
03765  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03766  * \brief  Return vertex neighbors that share an edge.
03767  *
03768  * \description
03769  *
03770  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03771  *    vertex neighbors for each vertex and the IDs of the vertex neighbors for
03772  *    each vertex. The array with the vertex IDs is a 2D array. Each vert's
03773  *    neighbor IDs are in sorted order. Get an vetex neighbor ID by
03774  *
03775  *    vertNeighsViaEdge[vertID][i];
03776  *
03777  *    where i is 0 ... numVertNeighsViaEdge[vertID] - 1. These are big data
03778  *    arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03779  *
03780  *    Note that edges may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03781  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03782  *
03783  *    Also note that if there cannot be any edges on the mesh (only happens
03784  *    for point meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
03785  *
03786  * \modifications
03787  *    - 10/31/05 WSD, created.
03788  */
03789 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshVertexNeighborsViaEdgePtr(
03790   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03791   int** numVertNeighsViaEdge,  /**< output - array of number of vert 
03792                                 neighbors per vert (that share an edge)*/
03793   int*** vertNeighsViaEdge  /**< output - array of arrays of vert neighbor
03794                                IDs, treat read only */
03795 ) {
03796   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03797   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03798   
03799   // default return
03800   if (numVertNeighsViaEdge)
03801     *numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
03802   if (vertNeighsViaEdge)
03803     *vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
03804 
03805   // check input
03806   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
03807   if (meshSlot == NULL || numVertNeighsViaEdge == NULL ||
03808       vertNeighsViaEdge == NULL) {
03809     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03810     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03811   }
03812   
03813   // log message
03814   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the faces on mesh '%s'", 
03815                       meshSlot->header.name);
03816 
03817   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
03818   if (meshSlot->numEdge < 0 || 
03819       (meshSlot->numEdge > 0 && meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge == NULL)) {
03820     rc = _fc_buildMeshVertexNeighborsViaEdge(mesh);
03821     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03822       return rc;
03823   }
03824 
03825   // return pointers
03826   *numVertNeighsViaEdge = meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge;
03827   *vertNeighsViaEdge = meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge;
03828   
03829   return FC_SUCCESS;
03830 }

03833  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh

03854                                 neighbors per elem (that share an vert)*/

03856                                IDs, treat read only */
03857 ) {

03864   if (elemNeighsViaVert)
03865     *elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
03866 
03867   // check input

03869   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemNeighsViaVert == NULL ||
03870       elemNeighsViaVert == NULL) {
03871     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03872     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03873   }
03874   
03875   // log message

03877                       meshSlot->header.name);
03878 
03879   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff

03881     rc = _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX);
03882     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03883       return rc;
03884   }
03885 
03886   // return pointers
03887   *numElemNeighsViaVert = meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert;
03888   *elemNeighsViaVert = meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert;
03889   
03890   return FC_SUCCESS;
03891 }

03918 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementNeighborsViaEdgePtr(
03919   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03920   int** numElemNeighsViaEdge,  /**< output - array of number of elem 
03921                                 neighbors per elem (that share an edge)*/

03923                                IDs, treat read only */
03924 ) {

03931   if (elemNeighsViaEdge)

03933
