03960 
03961 /**
03962  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
03963  * \brief  Return element neighbors that share an face.
03964  *
03965  * \description
03966  *
03967  *    This routine returns pointers to two arrays which hold the number of
03968  *    element neighbors for each element and the IDs of the element neighbors for
03969  *    each element. The array with the element IDs is a 2D array. Each elem's
03970  *    neighbor IDs are in sorted order. Get an vetex neighbor ID by
03971  *
03972  *    elemNeighsViaFace[elemID][i];
03973  *
03974  *    where i is 0 ... numElemNeighsViaFace[elemID] - 1. These are big data
03975  *    arrays and should NOT be freed by the calling program.
03976  *
03977  *    Note that faces may not yet exist for the mesh, and if they don't,
03978  *    calling this function will build them (which may take some time).
03979  *
03980  *    Also note that if there cannot be any faces on the mesh (only happens
03981  *    for point and line meshes), NULLs will be returned instead of arrays.
03982  *
03983  * \modifications
03984  *    - 10/31/05 WSD, created.
03985  */
03986 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getMeshElementNeighborsViaFacePtr(
03987   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03988   int** numElemNeighsViaFace,  /**< output - array of number of elem 
03989                                 neighbors per elem (that share an face)*/
03990   int*** elemNeighsViaFace  /**< output - array of arrays of elem neighbor
03991                                IDs, treat read only */
03992 ) {
03993   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03994   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
03995   
03996   // default return
03997   if (numElemNeighsViaFace)
03998     *numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
03999   if (elemNeighsViaFace)
04000     *elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
04001 
04002   // check input
04003   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04004   if (meshSlot == NULL || numElemNeighsViaFace == NULL ||
04005       elemNeighsViaFace == NULL) {
04006     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04007     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04008   }
04009   
04010   // log message
04011   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting parent elems of the faces on mesh '%s'", 
04012                       meshSlot->header.name);
04013 
04014   // if it doesn't exist, build stuff
04015   if (meshSlot->numFace < 0 || 
04016       (meshSlot->numFace > 0 && meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace == NULL)) {
04017     rc = _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(mesh, FC_AT_FACE);
04018     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04019       return rc;
04020   }
04021 
04022   // return pointers
04023   *numElemNeighsViaFace = meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace;
04024   *elemNeighsViaFace = meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace;
04025   
04026   return FC_SUCCESS;
04027 }
04028 
04029 /**
04030  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04031  * \brief Build an arrays of parent IDs.
04032  *
04033  * \description
04034  *
04035  *     Build arrays that hold the parent IDs for the requested child/parent
04036  *     combination.
04037  *              
04038  * \modifications  
04039  *      - 11/01/2005 WSD. Creatd to replace building parents lists
04040  *      in _fc_buildElements(), _fc_buildEdges, & _fc_buildFaces.
04041  */
04042 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildParents(
04043   FC_Mesh mesh,                  /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04044   FC_AssociationType childType,  /**< Child entity type. */
04045   FC_AssociationType parentType  /**< Parent entity type. */
04046 ) {
04047   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04048   int i, j;
04049   int numChild, numParent, *parentToChildConns, *numVertPerFace = NULL;
04050   int numChildPerParent, maxNumChildPerParent;
04051   int *numParentPerChild, **parentsPerChild;
04052    _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
04053    FC_ElementType elemType;
04054    FC_SortedIntArray* lists; // a list of parent IDs
04055   
04056   // check inputs
04057   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(childType) ||
04058       childType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || childType == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH ||
04059       !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(parentType) || parentType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || 
04060       parentType == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
04061     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04062     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04063   }
04064   if (childType >= parentType) {
04065     fc_printfErrorMessage("child type must be child of parent type");
04066     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04067   }
04068   
04069   // Setup I
04070   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, parentType, &numParent);
04071   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04072     return rc;
04073 
04074   // Special case, if the parent type doesn't exist, then we're done
04075   if (numParent == 0) 
04076     return FC_SUCCESS;
04077 
04078   // log message
04079   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04080   fc_printfLogMessage("Building vertex neighbors via edge on mesh '%s'", 
04081                       meshSlot->header.name);
04082 
04083   // Setup II
04084   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, childType, &numChild);
04085   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04086     return rc;
04087 
04088    rc = fc_getMeshEntityElementType(mesh, parentType, 0, &elemType);
04089   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04090     return rc;
04091  // this # gets overwritten or vert-face case
04092   maxNumChildPerParent = fc_getElementTypeNumEntity(elemType, childType);
04093   // do entity specific stuff - conns
04094   if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_EDGE) 
04095     rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04096   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_FACE) 
04097     rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFace, &maxNumChildPerParent,
04098                                 &parentToChildConns);
04099   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04100     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04101   // child = edge, parent = face not supported
04102   else if (childType == FC_AT_EDGE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04103     rc = fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04104   else if (childType == FC_AT_FACE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) 
04105     rc = fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &parentToChildConns);
04106   else {
04107     fc_printfErrorMessage("The combination: child = %s, parent = %s is "
04108                           "not supported",
04109                           fc_getAssociationTypeText(childType), 
04110                           fc_getAssociationTypeText(parentType));
04111     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04112   }
04113   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04114     return rc;
04115   lists = malloc(numChild*sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
04116   if (lists == NULL) {
04117     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04118     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04119   }
04120   for (i = 0; i < numChild; i++)
04121     fc_initSortedIntArray(&lists[i]);
04122 
04123   // for each Parent
04124   for (i = 0; i < numParent; i++) {
04125     if (numVertPerFace)
04126       numChildPerParent = numVertPerFace[i];
04127     else
04128       numChildPerParent = maxNumChildPerParent;
04129     // get parent's children & add parent ID to those children's lists
04130     for (j = 0; j < numChildPerParent; j++) {
04131       int ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&(lists[parentToChildConns[i*maxNumChildPerParent+j]]),
04132                    i);
04133       if (ret < 0) {
04134         fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
04135         return ret;
04136       }    
04137     }
04138   }
04139 
04140   // convert lists to arrays
04141   numParentPerChild = (int*)malloc(numChild*sizeof(int));
04142   parentsPerChild = (int**)calloc(numChild, sizeof(int*));
04143   if (numParentPerChild == NULL || parentsPerChild == NULL) {
04144     free(numParentPerChild);
04145     free(parentsPerChild);
04146     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04147     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04148   }
04149   for (i = 0; i < numChild; i++) {
04150     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&(lists[i]), &(numParentPerChild[i]),
04151                                 &(parentsPerChild[i]));
04152     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04153       return rc;
04154   }
04155 
04156   // cleanup 
04157   free(lists);
04158 
04159   // set results on mesh
04160   if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_EDGE) {
04161     meshSlot->numEdgePerVert = numParentPerChild;
04162     meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04163   }
04164   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_FACE) {
04165     meshSlot->numFacePerVert = numParentPerChild;
04166     meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04167   }
04168   else if (childType == FC_AT_VERTEX && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04169     meshSlot->numElemPerVert = numParentPerChild;
04170     meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert = parentsPerChild;
04171   }
04172   else if (childType == FC_AT_EDGE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04173     meshSlot->numElemPerEdge = numParentPerChild;
04174     meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge = parentsPerChild;
04175   }
04176   else if (childType == FC_AT_FACE && parentType == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04177     meshSlot->numElemPerFace = numParentPerChild;
04178     meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace = parentsPerChild;
04179   }
04180 
04181   return FC_SUCCESS;
04182 }
04183 
04184 /**
04185  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
04186  * \brief Special data blob for sorting edges
04187  *
04188  * \description
04189  *
04190  *    Used only in _fc_buildEdges().
04191  */
04192 typedef struct {
04193   int endVert;
04194   int edgeID;
04195 } _EdgeBlob;
04196  
04197 /**
04198  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04199  * \brief Build the edge info for the mesh
04200  *
04201  * \description
04202  *  
04203  *    Finds the unique list of edges for the given set of elements.
04204  *    It also adds edgeIDs arrays to each element.
04205  *
04206  *    Assumes that all elements are the same type.
04207  *
04208  * \modifications   
04209  *    - Wendy Koegler 4/02  Created
04210  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
04211  *    - 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections
04212  *      to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
04213  */
04214 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildEdgeConns(
04215   FC_Mesh mesh              /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04216 ) {
04217   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04218   int i, j, k;
04219   int numVertex, numElement, *elemConns;
04220   int numVertPerElem, numEdgePerElem, numEdge;
04221   int temp_ID;
04222   int *edgeConns, *elemToEdgeConns;
04223   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04224   FC_ElementType elemType;
04225   typedef int VertexIDPair[2];
04226   VertexIDPair vertexIDs;
04227   VertexIDPair* map; // map element's vertices to it's edges vertices
04228   // for 2D or less, edges are traversed in similar order to vertices
04229   // for 3D, edges traversed in order of faces, then faces edges (of course,
04230   // ignoring edges already traversed) -- see fc_buildFaces for face order.
04231   VertexIDPair lineMap[1] =    { { 0, 1 } };
04232   VertexIDPair triMap[3] =     { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 2 }, { 2, 0 } };
04233   VertexIDPair quadMap[4] =    { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 2 }, { 2, 3 }, { 3, 0 } };
04234   // tetMap: 3 from 1st face, 2 from 2nd face, 1 from 3rd face, 0 from base
04235   VertexIDPair tetMap[6] =     { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 3 }, { 3, 0 }, 
04236                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 3 }, 
04237                                  { 2, 0 } };
04238   // pyramidMap: 3 from 1st face, 2 from 2nd &3rd faces, 1 from 4th, 0 base
04239   VertexIDPair pyramidMap[8] = { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 4 }, { 4, 0 }, 
04240                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 4 }, 
04241                                  { 2, 3 }, { 3, 4 }, 
04242                                  { 3, 0 } };
04243   // prismMap: 4 for 1st face, 3 for 2nd face, 2 for 4rd face, 0 for base & top
04244   VertexIDPair prismMap[9] =   { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 4 }, { 4, 3 }, { 3, 0 }, 
04245                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 5 }, { 5, 4 }, 
04246                                  { 2, 0 }, { 3, 5 } };
04247   // hexMap: 4 for 1st face, 3 for 2nd & 3rd face, 2 for 4th face, 0 for b&t 
04248   VertexIDPair hexMap[12] =    { { 0, 1 }, { 1, 5 }, { 5, 4 }, { 4, 0 },
04249                                  { 1, 2 }, { 2, 6 }, { 6, 5 }, 
04250                                  { 2, 3 }, { 3, 7 }, { 7, 6 }, 
04251                                  { 3, 0 }, { 4, 7 } };
04252   // store edges in set of blob arrays, one for each vertex where the vertex
04253   // it is stored in is the first vertex of the edge after "sorting"
04254   // A sorted edge has the smaller vertID first
04255   // some will have multiple edges, some will have none
04256   FC_SortedBlobArray* edgeLists; // numVertex long
04257   _EdgeBlob *edgeBlob;
04258 
04259   // log
04260   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04261 
04262   // setup I, assume all elements are of same type
04263   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, &numVertex, &numElement, &elemType);
04264   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04265     return rc;
04266   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemConns);
04267   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04268     return rc;
04269   
04270   // handle the element type & pick the vertex map
04271   switch (elemType) {
04272   case FC_ET_POINT:
04273     // no edges for point elements, so no references to edges for verts
04274     meshSlot->numEdge = 0;    
04275     return FC_SUCCESS;  
04276   case FC_ET_LINE:     map = lineMap;     break;
04277   case FC_ET_TRI:      map = triMap;      break;
04278   case FC_ET_QUAD:     map = quadMap;     break;
04279   case FC_ET_TET:      map = tetMap;      break;
04280   case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  map = pyramidMap;  break;
04281   case FC_ET_PRISM:    map = prismMap;    break;
04282   case FC_ET_HEX:      map = hexMap;      break;
04283   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
04284   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:
04285     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't do element type %s",
04286                           fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
04287     return FC_ERROR;
04288   }
04289 
04290   // setup II
04291   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
04292   numEdgePerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumEdge(elemType);
04293   // assuming that calloc will get me same results as fc_initSortedBlobArray
04294   edgeLists = (FC_SortedBlobArray*)calloc(numVertex, sizeof(FC_SortedBlobArray));
04295   if (edgeLists == NULL) {
04296     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04297     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04298   }
04299 
04300   // Find unique edges, filling in each element's edgeIDs array as we go
04301   elemToEdgeConns = malloc(numElement*numEdgePerElem*sizeof(int));
04302   if (elemToEdgeConns == NULL) {
04303     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04304     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04305   }
04306   numEdge = 0;
04307   // for each element:
04308   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
04309     
04310     // for each edge
04311     for (j = 0; j < numEdgePerElem; j++) {
04312       int foundBlob, blobIdx;
04313       
04314       // get and sort edge's vertexIDs
04315       for (k = 0; k < 2; k++)
04316         vertexIDs[k] = elemConns[i*numVertPerElem+map[j][k]];
04317       if (vertexIDs[0] > vertexIDs[1]) {
04318         temp_ID = vertexIDs[0];
04319         vertexIDs[0] = vertexIDs[1];
04320         vertexIDs[1] = temp_ID;
04321       }
04322       
04323       // look in edgeList of first vertex for edge with 2nd vertex
04324       _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]], &vertexIDs[1],
04325                           fc_intCompare, &foundBlob, &blobIdx);
04326       if (foundBlob)  {
04327      edgeBlob = edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]].blobs[blobIdx];
04328       }
04329       else { // make an edge
04330      edgeBlob = (_EdgeBlob*)malloc(sizeof(_EdgeBlob));
04331         if (edgeBlob == NULL) {
04332           fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04333           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04334         }  
04335         edgeBlob->endVert = vertexIDs[1];
04336         edgeBlob->edgeID = numEdge;
04337      _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[vertexIDs[0]], blobIdx, 
04338                           edgeBlob);
04339         numEdge++;
04340       }
04341       elemToEdgeConns[i*numEdgePerElem+j] = edgeBlob->edgeID;
04342     }
04343   }
04344   
04345   // now build the edgeConns & edges array by walking array of edge lists
04346   edgeConns = malloc(2*numEdge*sizeof(int));
04347   if (edgeConns == NULL) {
04348     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04349     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04350   } 
04351   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
04352     for (j = 0; j < edgeLists[i].numBlob; j++) {
04353       edgeBlob = (_EdgeBlob*)edgeLists[i].blobs[j];
04354       temp_ID = edgeBlob->edgeID;
04355       edgeConns[2*temp_ID] = i;
04356       edgeConns[2*temp_ID + 1] = edgeBlob->endVert;
04357       free(edgeBlob);
04358     }
04359     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&edgeLists[i]);
04360   } 
04361   free(edgeLists);
04362 
04363   // set output
04364   meshSlot->numEdge = numEdge;
04365   meshSlot->edgeToVertConns = edgeConns;
04366   meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = elemToEdgeConns;
04367 
04368   return FC_SUCCESS;
04369 }
04370 
04371 /**
04372  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
04373  * \brief Special data blob for sorting faces.
04374  *
04375  * \description
04376  *
04377  *    Used only by _fc_faceNode_compare() in _fc_buildFaces().
04378  */
04379 typedef struct {
04380   FC_ElementType faceType;
04381   int vertexIDs[4];   // faces won't have more than 4 vertices
04382   int numVertex;
04383   int faceID;
04384 } _FaceBlob;
04385 
04386 /**
04387  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
04388  * \brief Compare two faces
04389  *
04390  * \description
04391  *
04392  *    To be used in this file (mesh.c) only for comparing faces.
04393  *    Expects faces to already be sorted so that smallest node ID
04394  *    is first and 2nd smallest vertex ID is next. (The order of the
04395  *    last 1 or 2 vertices is set by PATRAN ordering conventions.)
04396  *
04397  *    This method returns -1 if the first face's vertex IDs
04398  *    are smaller than the 2nd face's, 0 if the faces are the same;
04399  *    and 1 if the first face's vertex IDs are greater than the 2nd's.
04400  *
04401  *    Note, only the 1st 3 vertices are compared. In well behaved meshes, this
04402  *    should be suffient to compare faces. (I.e. we are assuming that quads
04403  *    will share 1, 2 or 4 vertices, but never just 3--if 3 are the same, all 4
04404  *    will be the same. We are also assuming that tris will not be "inside a
04405  *    quad" and therefore share 3 vertices.)
04406  *
04407  * \modifications
04408  *    - 10/10/2005 WSD. Promoted. Used to be inside _fc_buildFaces() but static
04409  *      functions not allowed inside funtions in gcc 4.0.
04410  */
04411 static int _faceBlob_compare(const void* node1, const void* node2) {
04412   const _FaceBlob* faceNode1 = (const _FaceBlob*)node1;
04413   const _FaceBlob* faceNode2 = (const _FaceBlob*)node2;
04414   
04415   if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[0] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[0]) 
04416     return -1;
04417   else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[0] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[0])
04418     return 1;
04419   else {
04420     if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[1] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[1])
04421       return -1;
04422     else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[1] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[1])
04423       return 1;
04424     else {
04425       if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[2] < faceNode2->vertexIDs[2])
04426         return -1;
04427       else if (faceNode1->vertexIDs[2] > faceNode2->vertexIDs[2])
04428         return 1;
04429       else 
04430         return 0;
04431     }
04432   }
04433 };
04434 
04435 /**
04436  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04437  * \brief Build the face info for the mesh
04438  *
04439  * \description
04440  *  
04441  *    Finds the unique list of faces for the given set of elements.
04442  *    It also adds faceIDs arrays to each element.
04443  *    The vertices in each face are ordered so that the "smallest"
04444  *    edge is first. That is, the smallest ID is first, then the
04445  *    edge from that vertex that has the smaller 2nd ID is next.
04446  *
04447  *    Assumes that if comparing first 3 vertices of two face and
04448  *    they are the same, it is the same face (follows from assuming 
04449  *    planar faces or some kind of well behaved mesh).
04450  *
04451  *    When the face type is FC_ET_MIXED (i.e. mix of triangles and quads
04452  *    for pyramid and prism meshes), the returned connectivity array
04453  *    will be of the size numFace*maxNumVertPerFace and for faces
04454  *    that have fewer vertices than maxNumVertPerFace, the remaining
04455  *    entries for that face will have values of -1. Although this
04456  *    takes up more space, this organization makes it easier to
04457  *    index to a particular face.
04458  *
04459  * \todo Make it so that unique faces will have orient of 1 in their element.
04460  *
04461  * \modifications   
04462  *    - 02/03/04 WSK, Created
04463  *    - 02/06/04 WSK, changed to return raw data arrays too.
04464  *    - 07/09/04 WSK, added building of upward and downward connections
04465  *      to vertices and elements (so could get rid of _fc_guildUpwardsConns).
04466  */
04467 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildFaceConns(
04468   FC_Mesh mesh       /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04469 ) { 
04470   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04471   int i, j, k;
04472   int numVertex, numElement, *elemConns;
04473   int numVertPerElem, numFacePerElem, numFace, maxNumVertPerFace;
04474   int idx, temp_ID, numVertexID;
04475   int* numVertPerFace, *faceConns, *elemToFaceConns, *elemFaceOrients;
04476   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
04477   FC_ElementType elemType, faceType, *faceTypes;
04478   typedef int VertexIDSet[4]; // faces can have maximum of 4 vertices
04479   int temp_vertexIDs[7]; // 2*n -1
04480   FC_ElementType* faceTypeMap;
04481   FC_ElementType triFaceTypeMap[1] =     { FC_ET_TRI };
04482   FC_ElementType quadFaceTypeMap[1] =    { FC_ET_QUAD };
04483   FC_ElementType tetFaceTypeMap[4] =     { FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, 
04484                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI };
04485   FC_ElementType pyramidFaceTypeMap[5] = { FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, 
04486                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_QUAD };
04487   FC_ElementType prismFaceTypeMap[5] =   { FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,
04488                                          FC_ET_TRI, FC_ET_TRI };
04489   FC_ElementType hexFaceTypeMap[6] =     { FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,
04490                                          FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD, FC_ET_QUAD,};
04491   VertexIDSet* map; // map element's vertex to it's faces vertices
04492   // Faces use exodus ordering 
04493   VertexIDSet triMap[1] =     { { 0, 1, 2, -1 } };
04494   VertexIDSet quadMap[1] =    { { 0, 1, 2, 3 } };
04495   // tetMap: 3 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base
04496   VertexIDSet tetMap[4] =     { { 0, 1, 3, -1 }, 
04497                                 { 1, 2, 3, -1 }, 
04498                                 { 0, 3, 2, -1 },
04499                                 { 0, 2, 1, -1 } }; 
04500   // pyramidMap: 4 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base
04501   VertexIDSet pyramidMap[8] = { { 0, 1, 4, -1 }, 
04502                                 { 1, 2, 4, -1 },
04503                                 { 2, 3, 4, -1 },
04504                                 { 0, 4, 3, -1 },
04505                                 { 0, 3, 2, 1 } };
04506   // prismMap: 3 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base & top
04507   VertexIDSet prismMap[9] =   { { 0, 1, 4, 3 },
04508                                 { 1, 2, 5, 4 }, 
04509                                 { 0, 3, 5, 2 }, 
04510                                 { 0, 2, 1, -1 }, 
04511                                 { 3, 4, 5, -1 } }; 
04512   // hexMap: 4 sides in same order as bottom verts, then base & top
04513   VertexIDSet hexMap[6] =     { { 0, 1, 5, 4 }, 
04514                                 { 1, 2, 6, 5 }, 
04515                                 { 2, 3, 7, 6 }, 
04516                                 { 0, 4, 7, 3 }, 
04517                                 { 0, 3, 2, 1 },
04518                                 { 4, 5, 6, 7 } };
04519   // store faces in set of blob arrays, one for each vertex where the vertex
04520   // it is stored in is the first vertex of the face after "sorting"
04521   // A sorted face as the smallest vertID first, and the second smallest
04522   // vertID 2nd, the traversal order may have to be "flipped" to do this.
04523   // some will have multiple faces, some will have none
04524   FC_SortedBlobArray* faceLists;
04525   _FaceBlob tempFaceBlob, *faceBlob;
04526 
04527   // log
04528   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04529 
04530   // setup I, assume all elements are of same type
04531   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, &numVertex, &numElement, &elemType);
04532   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04533     return rc;
04534   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemConns);
04535   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04536     return rc;
04537 
04538   // handle the element type & pick the vertex map & faceType
04539   switch (elemType) {
04540   case FC_ET_POINT:    // fall through to FC_ET_LINE!   
04541   case FC_ET_LINE:
04542     // no faces
04543     meshSlot->numFace = 0;      
04544     return FC_SUCCESS; 
04545   case FC_ET_TRI:    map = triMap;    faceTypeMap = triFaceTypeMap;    break;
04546   case FC_ET_QUAD:   map = quadMap;   faceTypeMap = quadFaceTypeMap;   break;
04547   case FC_ET_TET:    map = tetMap;    faceTypeMap = tetFaceTypeMap;    break;
04548   case FC_ET_PYRAMID: map = pyramidMap; faceTypeMap = pyramidFaceTypeMap; break;
04549   case FC_ET_PRISM:  map = prismMap;  faceTypeMap = prismFaceTypeMap;  break;
04550   case FC_ET_HEX:    map = hexMap;    faceTypeMap = hexFaceTypeMap;    break;
04551   case FC_ET_MIXED:    // fall through to FC_ET_UNKNOWN
04552   case FC_ET_UNKNOWN:
04553     fc_printfErrorMessage("can't do element type %s",
04554                           fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
04555     return FC_ERROR;
04556   }
04557   // if points or lines, don't need to make face list
04558 
04559   // setup II
04560   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
04561   numFacePerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumFace(elemType);
04562   // assuming that calloc will get me same results as fc_initSortedBlobArray
04563   faceLists = (FC_SortedBlobArray*)calloc(numVertex, sizeof(FC_SortedBlobArray));
04564   if (faceLists == NULL) {
04565     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04566     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04567   }
04568 
04569   // Find unique faces, filling in each element's faceIDs array as we go
04570   //printf("numVertex = %d, numElement = %d\n", numVertex, numElement);
04571   elemToFaceConns = malloc(numElement*numFacePerElem*sizeof(int));
04572   elemFaceOrients = malloc(numElement*numFacePerElem*sizeof(int));
04573   if (elemToFaceConns == NULL || elemFaceOrients == NULL) {
04574     free(elemToFaceConns);
04575     free(elemFaceOrients);
04576     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04577     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04578   }
04579   numFace = 0;
04580   // for each element:
04581   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
04582 
04583     // for each face
04584     for (j = 0; j < numFacePerElem; j++) {
04585       int foundBlob, blobIdx;
04586       numVertexID = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceTypeMap[j]);
04587       
04588       // get face's vertexIDs
04589       for (k = 0; k < numVertexID; k++)
04590         temp_vertexIDs[k] = elemConns[i*numVertPerElem+map[j][k]];
04591 
04592       // rotate array so smallest ID is first (keep order)
04593       idx = 0;
04594       temp_ID = temp_vertexIDs[0];
04595       for (k = 1; k < numVertexID; k++) {
04596         if (temp_vertexIDs[k] < temp_ID) {
04597           idx = k;
04598           temp_ID = temp_vertexIDs[k];
04599         }
04600       }
04601       for (k = 0; k < idx; k++) 
04602         temp_vertexIDs[numVertexID + k] = temp_vertexIDs[k];
04603 
04604       // Fill in temporary face
04605       tempFaceBlob.faceType = faceTypeMap[j];
04606       tempFaceBlob.numVertex = numVertexID;
04607 
04608       // Make the vertex array, & flip orientation if needed
04609       if (temp_vertexIDs[idx + 1] < temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - 1]) {        
04610         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = 1;
04611         for (k = 0; k < numVertexID; k++)
04612           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[k+idx];
04613       }
04614       else {
04615         elemFaceOrients[i*numFacePerElem+j] = -1;
04616         tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0] = temp_vertexIDs[idx];
04617         for (k = 1; k < numVertexID; k++)
04618           tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[k] = temp_vertexIDs[idx + numVertexID - k];
04619       }
04620 
04621       // look for entry in faceLists based on first vertex
04622       _fc_lookupBlobInSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
04623                           &tempFaceBlob, _faceBlob_compare,
04624                           &foundBlob, &blobIdx);
04625       if (foundBlob) {
04626      faceBlob = faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]].blobs[blobIdx];
04627       }
04628       else { // make a new face
04629      faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)malloc(sizeof(_FaceBlob));
04630      if (faceBlob == NULL) {
04631        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04632           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04633      }
04634      *faceBlob = tempFaceBlob; // check me!
04635         faceBlob->faceID = numFace;
04636      _fc_addEntryToSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[tempFaceBlob.vertexIDs[0]],
04637                           blobIdx, faceBlob);
04638         numFace++;
04639       }
04640       elemToFaceConns[i*numFacePerElem+j] = faceBlob->faceID;
04641     }
04642   }
04643 
04644   // now build the faceTypes, numVertPerFace, faceConns and faces arrays by walking array
04645   // of face lists
04646   faceType = fc_getElementTypeFaceType(elemType);
04647   maxNumVertPerFace = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(faceType);
04648   if (maxNumVertPerFace < 0 && faceType == FC_ET_MIXED)
04649     maxNumVertPerFace = 4; // only pyramids & prisms have mixed face type
04650   faceTypes = malloc(numFace*sizeof(FC_ElementType));
04651   numVertPerFace = malloc(numFace*sizeof(int));
04652   faceConns = malloc(numFace*maxNumVertPerFace*sizeof(int));
04653   if (faceTypes == NULL || numVertPerFace == NULL || faceConns == NULL) {
04654     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04655     free(faceTypes);
04656     free(numVertPerFace);
04657     free(faceConns);
04658     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04659   }
04660   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
04661     for (j = 0; j < faceLists[i].numBlob; j++) {
04662       faceBlob = (_FaceBlob*)faceLists[i].blobs[j];
04663       temp_ID = faceBlob->faceID;
04664       faceTypes[temp_ID] = faceBlob->faceType;
04665       numVertPerFace[temp_ID] = faceBlob->numVertex;
04666       memcpy(&faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID], faceBlob->vertexIDs,
04667              faceBlob->numVertex*sizeof(int));
04668       for (k = faceBlob->numVertex; k < maxNumVertPerFace; k++)
04669         faceConns[maxNumVertPerFace*temp_ID + k] = -1;
04670       free(faceBlob);
04671     }
04672     fc_freeSortedBlobArray(&faceLists[i]);
04673   } 
04674   free(faceLists);
04675 
04676   // set output
04677   meshSlot->numFace = numFace;
04678   meshSlot->faceTypes = faceTypes;
04679   meshSlot->numVertPerFace = numVertPerFace;
04680   meshSlot->faceToVertConns = faceConns;
04681   meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = elemToFaceConns;
04682   meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = elemFaceOrients;
04683 
04684   return FC_SUCCESS;
04685 }
04686 
04687 /**
04688  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04689  * \brief Build the neighbor information for the vertices array
04690  *
04691  * \description  
04692  *
04693  * \modifications   
04694  *    - WSK 02/24/04 WSK, created to build quick lookups for vertex neighbors
04695  *    - WSK 07/15/04 WSK, now only builds "edge" neighbors
04696  *    - WSK 10/31/05 WSK, takes mesh as argument instead of all the
04697  *      stuf it needs.
04698  */
04699 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshVertexNeighborsViaEdge(
04700   FC_Mesh mesh   /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04701 ) {
04702   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04703   int i;
04704   int numVert, numEdge, *edgeConns;
04705   int* numVertNeighsViaEdge, **vertNeighsViaEdge;
04706   _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
04707   FC_SortedIntArray *lists;  // a list of neighbor IDs
04708   
04709   // check inputs
04710   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh)) {
04711     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04712     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04713   }
04714   
04715   // log message
04716   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04717   fc_printfLogMessage("Building vertex neighbors via edge on mesh '%s'", 
04718                       meshSlot->header.name);
04719   
04720   // setup
04721   rc = fc_getMeshNumVertex(mesh, &numVert);
04722   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04723     return rc;
04724   rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
04725   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04726     return rc;
04727 
04728   // A little more checking
04729   if (numEdge < 1)
04730     return FC_SUCCESS; // Nothing to do
04731 
04732   // More setup
04733   rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &edgeConns);
04734   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04735     return rc;
04736 
04737   // for each edge, add each vertex to the other vertex's list
04738   lists = malloc(numVert*sizeof(FC_SortedIntArray));
04739   if (lists == NULL) {
04740     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04741     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04742   }
04743   for (i = 0; i < numVert; i++)
04744     fc_initSortedIntArray(&lists[i]);
04745   for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) {
04746     int ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[edgeConns[i*2+1]], edgeConns[i*2]);
04747     if (ret < 0) {
04748       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
04749       return ret;
04750     }
04751     ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&lists[edgeConns[i*2]], edgeConns[i*2+1]);
04752     if (ret < 0) {
04753       fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add id to sia");
04754       return ret;
04755     }
04756   }
04757 
04758   // convert neigh lists to arrays & store on mesh
04759   numVertNeighsViaEdge = (int*)malloc(numVert*sizeof(int));
04760   vertNeighsViaEdge = (int**)malloc(numVert*sizeof(int*));
04761   if (numVertNeighsViaEdge == NULL || vertNeighsViaEdge == NULL) {
04762     free(numVertNeighsViaEdge);
04763     free(vertNeighsViaEdge);
04764     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04765     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04766   }
04767   for (i = 0; i < numVert; i++) {
04768     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&(lists[i]), &(numVertNeighsViaEdge[i]),
04769                                 &(vertNeighsViaEdge[i]));
04770     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04771       return rc;
04772   }
04773   free(lists);
04774 
04775   // set results on mesh
04776   meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge = numVertNeighsViaEdge;
04777   meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge = vertNeighsViaEdge;
04778 
04779   return FC_SUCCESS;
04780 }
04781 
04782 /**
04783  * \ingroup PrivateMesh
04784  * \brief Build element neighbors that share the specified entity type.
04785  *
04786  * \description
04787  *
04788  *    Computes the big data arrays that store number of element neighbors
04789  *    per element and the ids of those neighbors.
04790  *
04791  *    This is a helper and should only be called internally. It doesn't
04792  *    have robust checking.
04793  *
04794  * \modifications
04795  *    - 10/31/2005 WSD. Created to replace _fc_buildElementNeighbors.
04796  *      Since the code is essentially the same for three possible
04797  *      share entity types, replace 3 specific versions with 1 general one.
04798  */
04799 FC_ReturnCode _fc_buildMeshElementNeighborsViaEntity(
04800   FC_Mesh mesh,   /**< The mesh to build stuff on. */
04801   FC_AssociationType sharedType /**< The type of shared entity */ 
04802 ) {
04803   FC_ReturnCode rc, rc2;
04804   int i, j;
04805   int numElem, numEntity, numEntityPerElem, entityID;
04806   int *elemToEntityConns, *numElemPerEntity, **elemParentsPerEntity;
04807   int *numElemNeighsViaEntity, **elemNeighsViaEntity;
04808   _FC_MeshSlot *meshSlot;
04809   FC_ElementType elemType;
04810   FC_SortedIntArray list; // list for each element
04811 
04812   // check inputs
04813   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(sharedType) || 
04814       sharedType == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || sharedType >= FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
04815     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04816     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04817   }
04818   // FIX?: Check that entity has topodim less than element
04819 
04820   // log message
04821   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
04822   fc_printfLogMessage("Building element neighbors via '%s' on mesh '%s'", 
04823                       fc_getAssociationTypeText(sharedType),
04824                       meshSlot->header.name);
04825 
04826   // setup
04827   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, NULL, NULL, &numElem, &elemType);
04828   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04829     return rc;
04830   rc = fc_getMeshNumEntity(mesh, sharedType, &numEntity);
04831   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04832     return rc;
04833   numEntityPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumEntity(elemType, sharedType);
04834 
04835   // A little more checking
04836   if (numEntity < 1) 
04837     return FC_SUCCESS; // Nothing to do
04838 
04839   // More setup 
04840   // FIX: replace this if wrapper calls become available
04841   switch(sharedType) {
04842   case FC_AT_VERTEX:
04843     rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
04844     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfVerticesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
04845                                              &elemParentsPerEntity);
04846     break;
04847   case FC_AT_EDGE:
04848     rc = fc_getMeshElementToEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
04849     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfEdgesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
04850                                            &elemParentsPerEntity);
04851     break;
04852   case FC_AT_FACE:
04853     rc = fc_getMeshElementToFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &elemToEntityConns);
04854     rc2 = _fc_getMeshElementParentsOfFacesPtr(mesh, &numElemPerEntity,
04855                                            &elemParentsPerEntity);
04856     break;
04857   default :
04858     ; // nothing
04859   }
04860   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04861     return rc;
04862   if (rc2 != FC_SUCCESS)
04863     return rc2;
04864 
04865   // FIX? different algorithm
04866   // This *might* be faster but will use more memory
04867   // For each entity, add it's parents to each other's lists
04868   // for (i = 0; i < numEntity; i++) {
04869   //   for (j = 0; j < numElemPerEntity[i]; j++) {
04870   //     for (k = 0; k < numElemPerEntity[i]; k++) {
04871   //       if (j != k) {
04872   //          fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&list[k], elemParentsPerEntity[i][j]);
04873   //          fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&list[j], elemParentsPerEntity[i][k]);
04874   //       }
04875   //     } 
04876   //   }
04877   // }
04878 
04879   // find neighbors
04880   numElemNeighsViaEntity = (int*)malloc(numElem*sizeof(int));
04881   elemNeighsViaEntity = (int**)malloc(numElem*sizeof(int*));
04882   if (numElemNeighsViaEntity == NULL || elemNeighsViaEntity == NULL) {
04883     free(numElemNeighsViaEntity);
04884     free(elemNeighsViaEntity);
04885     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04886     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04887   }
04888   for (i = 0; i < numElem; i++) {
04889     fc_initSortedIntArray(&list);
04890     for (j = 0; j < numEntityPerElem; j++) {
04891       entityID = elemToEntityConns[i*numEntityPerElem+j];
04892       int ret = fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(&list,
04893                                 numElemPerEntity[entityID],
04894                                 elemParentsPerEntity[entityID],
04895                                 0);
04896       if (ret < 0) {
04897      fc_printfErrorMessage("Failed to add entry to sia");
04898      return ret;    
04899       }
04900     }
04901     fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(&list, i); // don't count this elem
04902     rc = fc_convertSortedIntArrayToIntArray(&list, &numElemNeighsViaEntity[i],
04903                                 &elemNeighsViaEntity[i]);
04904     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04905       return rc;
04906   }
04907  
04908   // Set results on mesh
04909   // FIX?: pass array pointer to function call?
04910   switch(sharedType) {
04911   case FC_AT_VERTEX:
04912     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
04913     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert = elemNeighsViaEntity;
04914     break;
04915   case FC_AT_EDGE:
04916     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
04917     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge = elemNeighsViaEntity;
04918     break;
04919   case FC_AT_FACE:
04920     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace = numElemNeighsViaEntity;
04921     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace = elemNeighsViaEntity;
04922     break;
04923   default :
04924     ; // nothing
04925   }
04926 
04927   return FC_SUCCESS;
04928 }
04929 
04930 /**
04931  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
04932  * \brief  Initialize a mesh slot
04933  *
04934  * \modifications  
04935  *   APR-30-2003  W Koegler  Created. 
04936  */
04937 void _fc_initMeshSlot(
04938   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot    /**< input - the mtable slot to initialize */
04939 ) {
04940   // Note: tried to use the same order of members as the meshSlot declaration
04941   if (meshSlot != NULL) {
04942     _fc_initSlotHeader(&meshSlot->header);
04943     meshSlot->ds = FC_NULL_DATASET;
04944     //---
04945     meshSlot->fileInfo.id = -1;
04946     //---
04947     meshSlot->dim = 0;
04948     meshSlot->topodim = 0;
04949     meshSlot->numVertex = 0;
04950     meshSlot->numElement = 0;
04951     meshSlot->elemType = FC_ET_UNKNOWN;
04952     //---
04953     meshSlot->coords = NULL;
04954     meshSlot->elemToVertConns = NULL;
04955     //--
04956     meshSlot->numEdge = -1;
04957     meshSlot->numFace = -1;
04958     meshSlot->edgeToVertConns = NULL;
04959     meshSlot->faceTypes = NULL;
04960     meshSlot->numVertPerFace = NULL;
04961     meshSlot->faceToVertConns = NULL;
04962     meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns = NULL;
04963     meshSlot->elemToFaceConns = NULL;
04964     meshSlot->elemFaceOrients = NULL;
04965     //---
04966     meshSlot->numEdgePerVert = NULL;
04967     meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
04968     meshSlot->numFacePerVert = NULL;
04969     meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
04970     meshSlot->numElemPerVert = NULL;
04971     meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
04972     meshSlot->numElemPerEdge = NULL;
04973     meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
04974     meshSlot->numElemPerFace = NULL;
04975     meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
04976     //---
04977     meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
04978     meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
04979     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
04980     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
04981     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
04982     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
04983     meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
04984     meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
04985     //---
04986     meshSlot->numSub = 0;
04987     meshSlot->subIDs = NULL;
04988     //---
04989     meshSlot->coordVarID = -1;
04990     meshSlot->numBasicVar = 0;
04991     meshSlot->basicVarIDs = NULL;
04992     meshSlot->numSeqVar = 0;
04993     meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar = NULL;
04994     meshSlot->seqVarIDs = NULL;
04995   }   
04996 }
04997 
04998 /**
04999  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05000  * \brief  Release non-necessary information in a mesh slot.
05001  *
05002  * \description
05003  *  
05004  *    Releases the coordinates, connectivities and topology
05005  *    structures.
05006  *
05007  * \todo Make this smarter ....
05008  *
05009  * \modifications  
05010  *   Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05011  */
05012 void _fc_releaseMeshSlot(
05013   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlotp    /**< input - mtable pointer */
05014 ) {
05015   int i;
05016 
05017   // release big data
05018   //---
05019   if (meshSlotp->coords) {
05020     free(meshSlotp->coords);
05021     meshSlotp->coords = NULL;
05022   }
05023   if (meshSlotp->elemToVertConns) {
05024     free(meshSlotp->elemToVertConns);
05025     meshSlotp->elemToVertConns = NULL;
05026   }
05027   //---
05028   if (meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns) {
05029     free(meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns);
05030     meshSlotp->edgeToVertConns = NULL;
05031   }
05032   if (meshSlotp->faceTypes) {
05033     free(meshSlotp->faceTypes);
05034     meshSlotp->faceTypes = NULL;
05035   }
05036   if (meshSlotp->numVertPerFace) {
05037     free(meshSlotp->numVertPerFace);
05038     meshSlotp->numVertPerFace = NULL;
05039   }
05040   if (meshSlotp->faceToVertConns) {
05041     free(meshSlotp->faceToVertConns);
05042     meshSlotp->faceToVertConns = NULL;
05043   }
05044   if (meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns) {
05045     free(meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns);
05046     meshSlotp->elemToEdgeConns = NULL;
05047   }
05048   if (meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns) {
05049     free(meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns);
05050     meshSlotp->elemToFaceConns = NULL;
05051   }
05052   if (meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients) {
05053     free(meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients);
05054     meshSlotp->elemFaceOrients = NULL;
05055   }
05056   //---
05057   if (meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert) {
05058     free(meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert);
05059     meshSlotp->numEdgePerVert = NULL;
05060   }
05061   if (meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert) {
05062     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05063       free(meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert[i]);
05064     free(meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert);
05065     meshSlotp->edgeParentsPerVert = NULL;
05066   }
05067   if (meshSlotp->numFacePerVert) {
05068     free(meshSlotp->numFacePerVert);
05069     meshSlotp->numFacePerVert = NULL;
05070   }
05071   if (meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert) {
05072     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05073       free(meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert[i]);
05074     free(meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert);
05075     meshSlotp->faceParentsPerVert = NULL;
05076   }
05077   if (meshSlotp->numElemPerVert) {
05078     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerVert);
05079     meshSlotp->numElemPerVert = NULL;
05080   }
05081   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert) {
05082     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05083       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert[i]);
05084     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert);
05085     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerVert = NULL;
05086   }
05087   if (meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge) {
05088     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge);
05089     meshSlotp->numElemPerEdge = NULL;
05090   }
05091   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge) {
05092     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numEdge; i++)
05093       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge[i]);
05094     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge);
05095     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerEdge = NULL;
05096   }
05097    if (meshSlotp->numElemPerFace) {
05098     free(meshSlotp->numElemPerFace);
05099     meshSlotp->numElemPerFace = NULL;
05100   }
05101   if (meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace) {
05102     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numFace; i++)
05103       free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace[i]);
05104     free(meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace);
05105     meshSlotp->elemParentsPerFace = NULL;
05106   }
05107   //---
05108   if (meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge) {
05109     free(meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge);
05110     meshSlotp->numVertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05111   }
05112   if (meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge) {
05113     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numVertex; i++)
05114       free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge[i]);
05115     free(meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge);
05116     meshSlotp->vertNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05117   }
05118   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert) {
05119     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert);
05120     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05121   }
05122   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert) {
05123     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05124       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert[i]);
05125     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert);
05126     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaVert = NULL;
05127   }
05128   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge) {
05129     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge);
05130     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05131   }
05132   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge) {
05133     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05134       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge[i]);
05135     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge);
05136     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaEdge = NULL;
05137   }
05138   if (meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace) {
05139     free(meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace);
05140     meshSlotp->numElemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05141   }
05142   if (meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace) {
05143     for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numElement; i++)
05144       free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace[i]);
05145     free(meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace);
05146     meshSlotp->elemNeighsViaFace = NULL;
05147   }
05148 
05149   //---
05150   meshSlotp->numEdge = -1;
05151   meshSlotp->numFace = -1;
05152   
05153   return;
05154 }
05155 
05156 /**
05157  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05158  * \brief  Clear a mesh slot.
05159  *
05160  * \description
05161  *  
05162  *    Releases all dynamically allocated resources in a mesh,
05163  *    and reinitializes all members.
05164  *
05165  * \modifications  
05166  *   - Aug 6, 2002  W Koegler  Created
05167  *   - 2003-APR-31  W Koegler  Made more comprehensive
05168  */
05169 void _fc_clearMeshSlot(
05170  _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlotp       /**< input - vtable pointer */
05171 ) {
05172   int i;
05173 
05174   if (meshSlotp != NULL) {
05175     // release big data
05176     _fc_releaseMeshSlot(meshSlotp);
05177 
05178     // free other dynamic arrays
05179     if (meshSlotp->subIDs)
05180       free(meshSlotp->subIDs);
05181     if (meshSlotp->basicVarIDs)
05182       free(meshSlotp->basicVarIDs);
05183     if (meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar)
05184       free(meshSlotp->numStepPerSeqVar);
05185     if (meshSlotp->seqVarIDs) {
05186       for (i = 0; i < meshSlotp->numSeqVar; i++)
05187      free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs[i]);
05188       free(meshSlotp->seqVarIDs);
05189     }
05190 
05191     // clear table header
05192     _fc_clearSlotHeader(&meshSlotp->header);
05193 
05194     // reinit
05195     _fc_initMeshSlot(meshSlotp);
05196   }
05197 }
05198 
05199 /**
05200  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05201  * \brief  Get the size of the mesh table.
05202  *
05203  * \modifications  
05204  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
05205  */
05206 int _fc_getMeshTableSize() {
05207   return meshTableSize;
05208 }
05209 
05210 /**
05211  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05212  * \brief   Get an empty mesh slot from the mesh table.
05213  *
05214  * \description
05215  *  
05216  *    Will return a new slot or NULL. A NULL means a memory error occurred.
05217  *
05218  * \modifications  
05219  *    - 2003-MAY-01  W Koegler  Created
05220  *    - 12/08/03 WSK Changed because changed XTables from arrays of slots
05221  *      to arrays of handles to slots. The _fc_new_XSlot() routines do
05222  *      not call a common helper routine anymore.
05223  *    - 5/11/04 WSK  Moved common code from _fc_getNewDsSlot(), 
05224  *      _fc_getNewSeqSlot(), etc to _fc_getNewSlot().
05225  */
05226 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getNewMeshSlot() {
05227   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
05228 
05229   meshSlot = (_FC_MeshSlot*) _fc_getNewSlot(&meshTableSize, 
05230                              (_FC_SlotHeader***)&meshTable,
05231                            &meshOpenSlots, sizeof(_FC_MeshSlot));
05232   _fc_initMeshSlot(meshSlot);
05233 
05234   return meshSlot;
05235 }
05236 
05237 /**
05238  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05239  *
05240  * \brief Get a mesh slot from a mesh handle.
05241  *
05242  * \description
05243  * 
05244  *    The slot id of the mesh handle is used to find the
05245  *    the slot in the mesh table. The identity is then
05246  *    verified by checking that the slot and the handle's
05247  *    uIDs are the same. On success, a pointer to the slot 
05248  *    is returned. Otherwise a NULL pointer is returned.
05249  *
05250  * \modifications 
05251  *   - 2003-OCT-19  WSK  Created to replace using _fc_checkhandle and GET_ID 
05252  *       for better type checking (using pointer's to slots is less bug
05253  *       prone than lot's of xxxTable[xxxID] references).
05254  *   - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_isHandleValid common to all tables.
05255  */
05256 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlot(
05257   FC_Mesh mesh    /**< input - mesh */
05258 ) {
05259   if (_fc_isHandleValid(mesh.slotID, mesh.uID, meshTableSize,
05260                         (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable))
05261     return meshTable[mesh.slotID];
05262   else
05263     return NULL;
05264 }
05265 
05266 /**
05267  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05268  *
05269  * \brief Get a mesh slot based on ID.
05270  *
05271  * \description
05272  * 
05273  *    The _FC_MeshSlot at the requested slotID is returned. This should
05274  *    only be used when you really know that it is the slot you want
05275  *    because there is no checking of the uID like with _fc_getMeshSlot.
05276  *    The only checking is that the slotID is exists in the table and
05277  *    that the uID is > 0 (i.e. it is not empty).
05278  *
05279  * \modifications 
05280  *    - 11/27/03 WSK Created so that external routines can index into
05281  *      tables without knowing about them.
05282  *    - 05/25/04 WSK Changed to call new _fc_getSlot() common to all tables.
05283  */
05284 _FC_MeshSlot* _fc_getMeshSlotFromID(
05285   int meshID
05286 ) {
05287   return (_FC_MeshSlot*) _fc_getSlot(meshID, meshTableSize, 
05288                                      (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable);
05289 }
05290 
05291 /**
05292  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05293  * \brief Delete the mesh slot associated with the mesh handle.
05294  *
05295  * \description 
05296  *    
05297  *    This routine clears the dynamic data in the slot and then
05298  *    deletes the slot from the table.
05299  *
05300  * \modifications
05301  *   - 12/20/2005 WSD. Created.
05302  */
05303 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteMeshSlot(
05304   FC_Mesh mesh    /**< input - mesh */
05305 ) {
05306   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
05307   
05308   meshSlot = _fc_getMeshSlot(mesh);
05309   if (meshSlot == NULL) {
05310     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05311     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05312   }
05313 
05314   // do it
05315   _fc_clearMeshSlot(meshSlot);
05316   return _fc_deleteSlot(meshSlot->header.slotID, meshTableSize, 
05317                (_FC_SlotHeader**)meshTable, &meshOpenSlots);
05318 }
05319 
05320 /**
05321  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05322  * \brief  Print the contents of the Mesh Table (\ref meshTable) to stderr.
05323  *
05324  * \description
05325  *
05326  *    Prints the contents of the Mesh Table in a human readable form.
05327  *    It takes a string to use as a label for this print out of the table.
05328  *    Pass NULL if you don't want a label.
05329  *
05330  * \modifications 
05331  *    - Nancy Collins Created.
05332  *    - 2003-NOV-13  WSK  Fixed up.
05333  */
05334 void _fc_printMeshTable(
05335   char *label   /**< Input - label for this version the table (without a
05336                            trailing \\n) pass NULL if no label is desired */
05337 ) {
05338   int i, j, k;
05339   _FC_MeshSlot* meshSlot;
05340   
05341   // print table heading
05342   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
05343   fprintf(stderr, "Mesh Table (meshTable):\n");
05344   if (label != NULL)
05345     fprintf(stderr, "%s\n", label);
05346   fprintf(stderr, TABLE_DIVIDER_STRING);
05347   fflush(NULL);
05348 
05349   // We're done if it's empty
05350   if (meshTableSize < 1) {
05351     fprintf(stderr, "(empty)\n");
05352     fprintf(stderr, "\n");
05353     fflush(NULL);
05354     return;
05355   }
05356 
05357   // print contents for each slot
05358   for (i = 0; i <  meshTableSize; i++) {
05359     meshSlot = meshTable[i];
05360     fprintf(stderr, "%3d: %s\n", i, (meshSlot) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05361     if (meshSlot == NULL)
05362       continue;
05363     _fc_printSlotHeader(meshSlot->header);
05364     fprintf(stderr, "     FC_Dataset = { %d, %d }\n",
05365             meshSlot->ds.slotID, meshSlot->ds.uID);
05366     fprintf(stderr, "     dim = %d, topodim = %d\n", 
05367             meshSlot->dim, meshSlot->topodim);
05368     fprintf(stderr, "     numVertex = %d, coords = %s\n",
05369             meshSlot->numVertex, (meshSlot->coords) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05370     fprintf(stderr, "     numElement = %d, elemType = %s, elemConns = %s\n",
05371             meshSlot->numElement, fc_getElementTypeText(meshSlot->elemType), 
05372             (meshSlot->elemToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05373     fprintf(stderr, "     numEdge = %d, edgeConns = %s, elemToEdgeConns = %s\n",
05374             meshSlot->numEdge, (meshSlot->edgeToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05375             (meshSlot->elemToEdgeConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05376     fprintf(stderr, "     numFace = %d, faceType = %s, faceTypes = %s\n", 
05377             meshSlot->numFace,
05378             fc_getElementTypeText(fc_getElementTypeFaceType(meshSlot->elemType)),
05379             (meshSlot->faceTypes) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05380     fprintf(stderr, "         numVertPerFace = %s, faceConns = %s\n",
05381             (meshSlot->numVertPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
05382             (meshSlot->faceToVertConns) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05383     fprintf(stderr, "         elemToFaceConns = %s, elemFaceOrients = %s\n",
05384             (meshSlot->elemToFaceConns) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05385             (meshSlot->elemFaceOrients) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05386     fprintf(stderr, "     numEdgePerVert = %s, edgeParentsPerVert = %s\n",
05387             (meshSlot->numEdgePerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05388             (meshSlot->edgeParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05389     fprintf(stderr, "     numFacePerVert = %s, faceParentsPerVert = %s\n",
05390             (meshSlot->numFacePerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05391             (meshSlot->faceParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05392     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerVert = %s, elemParentsPerVert = %s\n",
05393             (meshSlot->numElemPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05394             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05395     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerEdge = %s, elemParentsPerEdge = %s\n",
05396             (meshSlot->numElemPerEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05397             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05398     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemPerFace = %s, elemParentsPerFace = %s\n",
05399             (meshSlot->numElemPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL",
05400             (meshSlot->elemParentsPerFace) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05401     fprintf(stderr, "     numVertNeighsViaEdge = %s, vertNeighsViaEdge = %s\n",
05402             (meshSlot->numVertNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
05403             (meshSlot->vertNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05404     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaVert = %s, elemNeighsViaVert = %s\n",
05405             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaVert) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
05406             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaVert) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05407     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaEdge = %s, elemNeighsViaEdge = %s\n",
05408             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
05409             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaEdge) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05410     fprintf(stderr, "     numElemNeighsViaFace = %s, elemNeighsViaFace = %s\n",
05411             (meshSlot->numElemNeighsViaFace) ? "exists" : "NULL", 
05412             (meshSlot->elemNeighsViaFace) ? "exists" : "NULL");
05413     fprintf(stderr, "     numSub = %d, subIDs = ", meshSlot->numSub);
05414     if (meshSlot->numSub == 0) 
05415       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
05416     else {
05417       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->subIDs[0]);
05418       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numSub; j++)
05419         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->subIDs[j]);
05420       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
05421     }
05422     fprintf(stderr, "     coordVarID = %d\n", meshSlot->coordVarID); 
05423     fprintf(stderr, "     numBasicVar = %d, basicVarIDs = ", 
05424             meshSlot->numBasicVar);
05425     if (meshSlot->numBasicVar == 0) 
05426       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
05427     else {
05428       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->basicVarIDs[0]);
05429       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numBasicVar; j++)
05430         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->basicVarIDs[j]);
05431       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
05432     }
05433     fprintf(stderr, "     numSeqVar = %d, numStepPerSeqVar = ", meshSlot->numSeqVar);
05434     if (!meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar)
05435       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
05436     else {
05437       fprintf(stderr, "{ %d", meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[0]);
05438       for (j = 1; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++)
05439         fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]);
05440       fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
05441     }
05442     fprintf(stderr, "     seqVarIDs = ");
05443     if (!meshSlot->seqVarIDs) 
05444       fprintf(stderr, "NULL\n");
05445     else {
05446       fprintf(stderr, "{\n");
05447       for (j = 0; j < meshSlot->numSeqVar; j++) {
05448      fprintf(stderr, "         seqVarIDs[%d] = { %d", j, 
05449                   meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][0]);
05450      for (k = 1; k < meshSlot->numStepPerSeqVar[j]; k++)
05451        fprintf(stderr, ", %d", meshSlot->seqVarIDs[j][k]);
05452      fprintf(stderr, " }\n");
05453       }
05454       fprintf(stderr, "     }\n");
05455     }
05456     fflush(NULL);
05457   }
05458   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
05459   fflush(NULL);
05460 
05461   return;
05462 }
05463 
05464 /**
05465  * \ingroup  PrivateMesh
05466  * \brief  Free all entries in the mesh table
05467  *
05468  * \description
05469  *
05470  *    This should only be called after making sure that
05471  *    all slots have been cleared.
05472  *
05473  * \modifications  
05474  *   - 05/21/04 WSK Created.
05475  */
05476 void _fc_freeMeshTable() {
05477   int i;
05478   for (i = 0; i < meshTableSize; i++) {
05479     _fc_clearMeshSlot(meshTable[i]);
05480     free(meshTable[i]);
05481   }
05482   free(meshTable);
05483   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&meshOpenSlots);
05484   meshTableSize = 0;
05485   meshTable = NULL;
05486 }
